qas.question: What did Martin think Eisenhower did too much of in his relations with Congress?
As a result of Eisenhower's actions toward Congress, what did Martin think Congress often gave him?

answers.text: reverse of what he has desired

qas.question: Who did Martin think Eisenhower should have made better use of?

context: Speaker Martin concluded that Eisenhower <a0_0>worked too much through subordinates<a0_0/> in dealing with Congress, with results, "often the <a1_0>reverse of what he has desired<a1_0/>" because Members of Congress, "resent having some young fellow who was picked up by the White House without ever having been elected to office himself coming around and telling them 'The Chief wants this'. The administration never made use of many <a2_0>Republicans of consequence<a2_0/> whose services in one form or another would have been available for the asking."
